posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
It's that time of the week again! Here are some events this weekend you might enjoy:

  • Sweet seven: Black Apple is turning seven, and they are celebrating with their 2nd annual birthday bash on July 31.
  • Brain freeze: You could win a year's worth of ice cream and a brain freeze competing in Freeze Fest at the Bentonville Farmer's Market .
  • Daredevils: See the Ozark Mountain Daredevils and The Creek Rocks at another edition of the Forest Concert Series on Saturday.
  • Two for one: The 112 Drive-In will be showing two movies, including ELVIS, for the price of one this weekend,
  • Art, bikes, and fun: With four different routes, anyone can enjoy Saturday's Tour de Frida and the pop up market, food and drinks, and art installments to go along with it.
  • Amped up: Chris Stapleton is in town for a show tonight at the Walmart AMP. Tickets are sold out, but a few are available on secondary.
  • Well read: Check out the Bentonville Public Library this weekend for its back to school sale with over 40,000 books available.

Have fun, stay safe, and we'll see you next week!

posts.title: Calling All Food and Farm Entrepreneurs
posts.content:
Cureate and FORGE, Inc. are seeking up-and-coming food and beverage entrepreneurs to participate in a free 10-week cohort intended to empower small businesses for success in a highly competitive food industry.

  • Cureate courses: There are three cohorts planned for the 2022-2023 school year, the first of which will begin on September 27 with a focus on consumer packaged goods, beverages, and baked goods. 
  • The great Cureate bake-off: At the end of each cohort, the 10 businesses selected will participate in a pitch showcase for a chance to win $5,000. 

Learn more and apply HERE.

posts.title: Big Time Rush Back On Tour At Walmart AMP
posts.content:
They may have started as a Nickelodeon boy band, but Big Time Rush has since come of age with #1 singles and chart topping songs. Currently on an international tour, they make a stop Tuesday at the Walmart AMP.

  • Bit of history: In 2013, the band split up to go their separate ways. But in 2020, when the world was keeping its distance, the four members - Carlos, Kendall, James and Logan - reunited to their fans’ delight.
  • Boys back in town: Now the Big Time Rush boys are hitting the road together again in their Forever Tour – and taking the Walmart AMP stage for the first time this Tuesday, Aug 2! Make it a double date and save $10 with the lawn four-pack tickets available for $80.

Find out more about the show and buy tickets HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • AcreTrader is hiring for two FP&A positions - a Director and a Senior Manager
  • SOAR Afterschool is looking for Afterschool Program Leaders

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here, and we might feature it next week!

posts.title: Whataburger Coming To Siloam Springs
posts.content:
Earlier this week, Whataburger announced plans to open a new store in Siloam Springs. 

  • Whataneighbor: The community is excited to welcome Whataburger which has a great reputation for community partnerships through their Feeding Student Success Program. 
  • Whatajob: Referring to employees as “family members”, the company has plans to hire more than 100 people in the Siloam Springs area. 

Read more on the story from 5News HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Showcase: Walton Arts Center is inviting local and regional artists to submit their visual arts for a chance to be featured in an exhibition.
  • Furry friends: Fayetteville Animal Shelter is offering free dog adoptions through Aug 6.
  • Facelift: The newly remodeled Walmart in Springdale is having a grand re-opening tomorrow, July 30.
  • Get away: Walmart is partnering with Getaway, a tiny cabin rental company, to provide tiny retail shops at Getaway sites. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.
